title: Drawing, "Design for an Ornament Panel", 1733–34
medium: Pen and brown and black ink, black chalk, brush and yellow, pale green, gray, and brown washes on white laid paper
markings: Signed in ink, lower left: Meissonier. [sic]
provenance: Léon Decloux; in his collection in 1906.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Within a rocaille cartouche frame is a sunburst surrounding a putto on the back of an eagle, wings outspread. The eagle rests on a cloud and holds a bolt of lightning with its right foot.  Verso: fragment of geometrical accounting (in pencil) in "p(ied)s" and "po(uces)."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for an Ornament Panel", 1733–34.
1733–34. Pen and brown and black ink, black chalk, brush and yellow, pale green, gray, and brown washes on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-215.
